intro: Stenogyne huluhuluensis, commonly known as the Huluhulu mountain mallow, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian island of Maui. It belongs to the family Loganiaceae and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as mesic forests and streamside areas. It has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
